title: [Large-scale] Technology-Enhanced Social Education Design for Secondary School Teachers Aged 40+

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone application usage skills and foundational secondary-level social studies concepts
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, emphasizing practical content immediately applicable to school settings post-training

learning_goals: Learners design methods to integrate four or more digital tools (video editors, survey apps, collaboration platforms, augmented reality apps) into social studies lessons.
Learners identify three or more ethical issues (privacy protection, copyright, digital divide) arising in technology-integrated lesson design and propose solutions.
Learners develop two types of interactive learning materials (quiz-based content, virtual field surveys) creatable via smartphones and improve them through peer assessment

resources: Low-capacity video creation tool (CapCut mobile version)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
